title: Boundless & Tetherless VR
description:
Using affordable and accessible computing components mounted to a Google Cardboard, I developed algorthms to afford entirely boundless and tetherless tracking of planar movement.

Now, VR participants can walk around a virtual environment intuitively (by walking synonymously through their physical environment), and freely (unencumbered by wires and by bounds on walkable sapce).

A Raspberry Pi Zero performs realtime sensor fusion from a gyroscope and downward-mounted camera. It provides both direction and intensity of movement, affording sufficient information for meaningful interaction in virtual reality experiences. The device works indoor or outdoor. It is limited only by the duration of the charge on the battery powering the device.

Though never developed into a commercial device, this prototype proves the potential of effective and affordable tracking with off-the-shelf components and some well-written code. See below for demos and specifics of the algorithm.
